ThingDef.label: apini front leg
ThingDef.description: Various forms of legs exist as means of locomotion, in various configurations - digitigrade, plantigrade, I really liked my teacher in second grade.

ThingDef.label: leg
ThingDef.description: Rumour has it that Apini legs are a delicacy on certain urbworlds, supposedly tasting like grade-A Honey marinated crab...

ThingDef.label: Apini wing
ThingDef.description: Wings from an Apini. Why would you take these off? You probably pulled wings off flies as a kid, didn't you? Meanie.

ThingDef.label: Apini stomach
ThingDef.description: Digests food and turns it into energy and nutrients. This one comes from an Apini... It's rather... strange.

ThingDef.label: Apini heart
ThingDef.description: Supplies blood and oxygen to all parts of the body. Ready to find a new owner. Provided that new owner is an Apini. These is an insect heart after all.

ThingDef.label: Apini eyeball
ThingDef.description: Absorbs light, which lets a person (an Apini person in this case) know what's around them.

ThingDef.label: Apini antennae
ThingDef.description: Picks up vibrations in the air, and other sensory data. Functions may variously include sensing touch, air motion, heat, vibration (sound), and especially smell or taste.

ThingDef.label: Apini Mandible
ThingDef.description: As opposed to teeth, insects generally have Mandibles. Their function is typically to grasp, crush, or cut the insectâ€™s food, or to defend against predators or rivals.
